metadata.title: CVE-2018-1000223 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
soundtouch version up to and including 2.0.0 contains a Buffer Overflowvulnerability in SoundStretch/WavFile.cpp:WavInFile::readHeaderBlock() thatcan result in arbitrary code execution. This attack appear to beexploitable via victim must open maliocius file in soundstretch utility.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1000223` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsoundtouch1 - 2.1.2+ds1-1
soundstretch - 2.1.2+ds1-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: soundtouch package in esm-apps/jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.2+ds1-1').
